issue.title: statsfa.com
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://statsfa.com/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fstatsfa.com%2F) ### Comment > Hello AdGuard Team, > > I hope you are doing well. > > I’ve encountered an issue when using AdGuard with the website statsfa.com > . The site does not display correctly due to AdGuard’s security settings. At first, I thought it might be a conflict with the Brave browser, but after further testing, I realized the issue occurs in all browsers. > > It seems that AdGuard interferes with this website (which is a WordPress statistics plugin), causing its CSS not to load at all and breaking the layout completely. > > I kindly ask you to look into this problem and provide a fix in future updates so the site can function properly. > > Thank you for your support and great work. ### Screenshots

issue.title: Better Klaviyo tracking

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

labels.name: A: Waiting for data
labels.description: Waiting for more information from the user

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [x] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [x] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [x] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

### Problem description

Klaviyo Javascript is being blocked due to the addition of this rule

```
||static.klaviyo.com/onsite/js/telemetry
||static.klaviyo.com/onsite/js/event_adapter
||a.klaviyo.com
```


### Proposed solution

The correct blocked script should be

```
||static-tracking.klaviyo.com/onsite/*
```
which blocks any analytics scripts/API requests/etc that Klaviyo uses for shopper identification.

We should _not_ be blocking requests to `a.klaviyo.com`. That rule should be removed.

### Additional information

A similar issue was submitted: https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/210120#issuecomment-3128250521

But the fix implemented was not the proposed solution.

comment.body:
@owen-carpenter-klaviyo Ok, got it. Maybe it is possible to use for
https://a.klaviyo.com/media/js/onsite/onsite.js
and
https://a.klaviyo.com/onsite/track-analytics?company_id=SkhBqk
different subdomains? For example, t.klaviyo.com for tracking, or existing static-tracking.klaviyo.com.

The problem (not for most users, apparently) is that we don't receive any complaints about the current blocking option.
I don't know how many users subscribe to such mailings, but personally, I find it annoying and not entirely ethical (emails and phone numbers are collected). Our filter, that blocks such subcriptions is popular.

Many users prefer maximum protection against tracking. But this filter is not enabled by default.
